decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers:
2012_300 Rev P01 (Ground Floor Plan - Proposed);
2012_301 Rev P01 (First Floor Plan - Proposed);
2012_302 Rev P01 (Second Floor Plan - Proposed);
2012_303 Rev P01 (Roof Plan - Proposed);
2012_400 Rev P01 (Elevations 1 - Existing and Proposed);
2012_401 Rev P01 (Elevations 2 - Existing and Proposed);
2012_402 Rev P01 (Elevations 3 - Existing and Proposed);
2012_403 Rev P01 (Elevations 4 - Existing and Proposed);
2012_404_A Rev P01 (Elevations - Temporary Container Elevations)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with those described in the hereby approved drawings listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing DM DPD (2013), Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18) and the NPPF (2023).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a detailed Delivery and Servicing Plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The servicing of the site shall be operated in accordance with the details approved and shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for occupants of the nearby residential units, in accordance with Policies T2, T3, T4, T7 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing DM DPD (2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a detailed Car Parking Design and Management Plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Car Parking Design and Management Plan shall include the following details:
a)  The proposed layout, distribution, accumulation of and arrangements for the management of:
i) Car parking
ii) Blue badge car parking
b) Measures for preventing parking in undesignated places throughout the site
c) The provision of active and passive Electric Vehicle Charging Points
d) Measures to achieve a phased reduction of car parking, working towards the aim of a car free development
The car parking shall be provided and managed in accordance with the approved strategy for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:  To ensure inclusive, safe and adequate parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in the interests of the general amenities of the locality, the flow of traffic and conditions of pedestrian and general highway safety within the site and on neighbouring highways, a sustainable development and where appropriate constrain local highway impact, in accordance with Policies T2, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) 1.1(g) and 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012).

| Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a detailed Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Travel Plan shall be prepared in accordance with the Transport for London Travel Plan Guidance and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPD in use at the time of its preparation. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Travel Plan.

Reason: To promote sustainable modes of transport, and to ensure that the development does not exacerbate congestion on the local road network, in accordance with Policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012) and Policies T1, T3, T4, T5, SI1 and SI2 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG.

| Prior to commencement of the hereby approved development, details of the cycle storage facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of the stores, the location of the stores and the materials for the store. The approved storage areas shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:  Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until a tree protection plan for the protection of existing trees has been submitted and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
All protection measures must take into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works. Details shall include the following:

o Full survey of all trees on site and those within influencing distance on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals. All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.

o A schedule of tree works for all the retained trees specifying pruning and other remedial or preventative work, whether for physiological, hazard abatement, aesthetic or operational reasons. All tree works shall be carried out in accordance with BS 3998.
o Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
o Level changes
o Landscaping proposals

o A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
o Details of the arboricultural supervision schedule.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the
Local Planning Authority)

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies G5, G7 and SI 1 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.
| The development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with a suitable Tree Monitoring Program.
(a) Prior to the commencement of development (including ground works and site clearance), the following shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
A tree monitoring program to include:
o Confirmation of who shall be the lead arboriculturalist for the development.
o Confirmation of the Site Manager, key personnel, their key responsibilities and contact details.
o A detailed timetable of events for arboricultural supervision concerning all tree protection measures within the approved Tree Protection Plan, including:
o Demolition of structures within the root protection area
o Initial implementation/installation of the tree protection measures
o Final removal of the tree protection measures
o Removal of the existing hard surface within the root protection area
o Instillation of new hard surface within the root protection area.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies G5, G7 and SI 1 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.

| The permission for five (5) storage containers shall be for a limited period of 3 years only, expiring on 15/09/2026 when the use hereby permitted shall be discontinued and the storage containers removed and the land reinstated to its former condition to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: The siting, design and materials of construction are not considered suitable for a permanent building/structure, in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing DM DPD (2013), Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 18) and the NPPF (2023).

| Vehicles, including forklifts, shall use broadband reversing alarms or alternative quiet safety methods for reversing during deliveries, collections and general movements, and observe the DfT Guidance 'Delivering the goods: Guidance on delivery restrictions' and the FTA (Freight Transport Association) Guidance 'Delivering the goods'.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for occupants of the nearby residential units, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Policy 7A of the Ealing DM DPD (2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration
| During the implementation of the development hereby approved, control measures shall ensure that the following standards and requirements are implemented and adhered to:
o noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
o dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
o lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
o hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
o neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
o public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing DM DPD (2013), Policy D14 of the London Plan 2021, the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise density.
description: Single storey building for use as storage (Use Class B8) on southern boundary of site (following removal of storage containers); five storage containers on northern boundary of site for a temporary period (part retrospective)
